Tables

Tables are used to display rows of data.

Example

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Guidelines

  • Ensure your table is designed in a way that allows users to easily scan, analyze, compare, sort, filter, and derive insights from the data being displayed. The value of your table is based on how easily your users can view and act upon the data being displayed.
  • Follow best practices for data alignment and column styling in the table.
    • Right align numeric values
    • Left align text
    • Center align any buttons, links, or action icons
    • Align column titles with column data. For column titles that span multiple columns, use center alignment.
    • Resize column widths to match length the data
  • If your table contains more than 25 lines, pagination should be used. By default, the Datatable plugin will only display 10 items per page.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.table-uxf-traditional add class to table.table element to apply traditional table styles
.table-uxf-modern add class to table.table element to apply modern table styles

Javascript

Datatables use the DataTables library included in UXFrame Plus and require .uxf-datatables to be added to the .uxf containing element.

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

  1. Remove .sortable from table elements
  2. Remove .check-col from td elements
  3. Remove .odd from tr elements. Put .table-striped on the table element instead.
  4. UXF v2 does not assume all columns are sortable. Remove .sort-none class from th elements. Add .uxf-sort to th elements that are sortable.
  5. Change table .jd-table.traditional-table to table .table.table-uxf-traditional
  6. Change table .jd-table.modern-white-table to table .table.table-uxf-modern
  7. Change th .sort-up to th .uxf-sort-up
  8. Change th .sort-down to th .uxf-sort-down
  9. Add thead and tbody elements inside the table in their respective canonical places
  10. Add .uxf-datatables to the .uxf containing element if using a datatable

Accessibility

Make sure to associate the data cells with their appropriate headers. If the header is being used as a column header, it should have a scope="col". If the header is being used as a row header, it should have a scope="row". For more information, check out WebAIM's Creating Accessible Tables.
